title: Racial views of Donald Trump
deleted: In June 2020, Facebook removed Trump campaign ads that included an upside down red triangle, a symbol which the Nazis had used to label opponents of their regime. The Trump campaign claimed that the symbol was used by [[Antifa (United States)|Antifa]], but experts contend that this is inaccurate and some critics viewed the symbol as a racist [[Dog-whistle politics|dog whistle]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=Morrison|first=Sara|date=June 18, 2020|title=Facebook takes down another Trump campaign ad, this time for Nazi imagery|url=https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/6/18/21295226/facebook-trump-campaign-nazi-symbol-antifa|access-date=June 22, 2020|website=Vox|language=en}}</ref> Facebook stated that "We removed these posts and ads for violating our policy against organized hate."<ref>{{Cite news|last=Karni|first=Annie|date=June 18, 2020|title=Facebook Removes Trump Ads Displaying Symbol Used by Nazis|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/18/us/politics/facebook-trump-ads-antifa-red-triangle.html|access-date=June 21, 2020|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
